Description: Bronze lamp: shallow bowl-body and short, necked nozzle moulded on the underside as a scallop-shell, with a crinkled edge round the upper side. The neck of the nozzle has a cabled band, extending from which, on the flat top of the nozzle, is a simple engraved floral pattern. Oval wick-hole. The top is dished, with concentric mouldings within the rounded shoulder; a further group of mouldings surrounds the small filling-hole. Engraved into the top of the lamp, concentric with the mouldings, is a well-cut Greek inscription of the owner. On each side of the body, in high relief, is a dolphin. Base-ring with internal 'lathe-turned' mouldings. Several holes are broken through the body. Surface colouration: green.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (3709)
Condition: fair - some holes. Surface coloration: green.
